Problem:
Assume a linear system of equations represented in matrix form \\( Ax = b \\), where \\( A \\) is an invertible matrix. Analyze scenarios applying the Laplace transform to the function \\( x(t) = e^{At}x_0 \\), with \\( x_0 \\) being the initial conditions, over the time domain.

By applying the Laplace transform to the system \\( x(t) = e^{At}x_0 \\) at t = 0 and evolving under linear dynamics without further intervention, does the Laplace transform of the solution differ from if it was applied directly to the evolved state at a later time t = T?
Explanation: The Laplace transform of \\( x(t) \\) given by \\( \\mathcal{L}(e^{At}x_0)(s) = (sI - A)^{-1} x_0 \\) is independent of the specific instance of t when applied, thus transforming the initial state or the state at any later time T results in the same expression due to the properties of the exponential matrix function and linearity of the Laplace transform.
